name: Best Com. ASHP, Env., PC (EE+DFâ€“LFL) CC
_description: Typical size light commercial rooftop HP unit that meets the best available performance level in 2017, adjust heating/cooling set point down/up to shed peak period electricity use, pair with passive thermal energy storage and envelope/HVAC equipment efficiency generally corresponding to AEDG 50% guideline across building types, cold-climate, like-for-like

market_entry_year_source.notes: Assume historical penetration is captured in the baseline

energy_efficiency_source: Determined by custom savings shape information in 'tsv_features'

installed_cost_source.notes: Total installed cost for high efficiency RTHP in 2023 divided by typical output capacity (90 kBtu/h); assumes no additional costs for load shifting capabilities

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetimes for high efficiency RTU in 2023

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.title: CBECS 2018 - Table E1 -  Major fuels consumption by end use, 2018
market_scaling_fractions_source.fraction_derivation: Ventilation fraction is portion of ventilation in commercial buildings that use HP for heating (102 TBtus / 728 TBtus).

_notes: Measure Definition and Status Google spreadsheet contains calculations for combining RTU and commercial envelope measures and converting units
